discussion.content:
Description by AI
Open file backup is the ability to take a “hot” snapshot of a file, drive, or partition being used by other software without stopping.

questions.question_text: Which of the following technologies can successfully back up files that are used by other processes without stopping those processes?

A storage administrator is configuring a new array to provide storage to a virtual cluster. The array has a built-in backup agent to allow data that is stored on the array to be backed up. The storage administrator wants the virtual cluster to use a file-based storage protocol so the backup agent can just back up the files that change and not the whole data store. Which of the following storage protocols should the administrator use?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
(D) Network File System is the only file-based storage protocol listed.
I wonder who is choosing the wrong answers in this website for this course?

Selected Answer: D
The best policy to deter a brute-force login attack is D. Account lockout threshold. This policy directly limits the number of login attempts, thereby preventing an attacker from continuously attempting to guess the correct password. Implementing an account lockout threshold makes brute-force attacks impractical by significantly increasing the time required to successfully guess a password.

Selected Answer: D
Because a policy of locking out accounts after a certain number of failed login attempts can effectively deter brute-force attacks. This is because the attacker will be unable to continue trying different passwords once the account has been locked out, making it more difficult to gain unauthorized access.

Selected Answer: D
Attacker cannot continue to try different passwords if the account gets locked out. That's actually from A+.
Dis the correct answer, locking out the user or attacker after few tries will prevent that

D Lockout policy is the BEST option 
The other options create a strong password policy

questions.question_text: Which of the following policies would be BEST to deter a brute-force login attack?
An administrator is working on improving the security of a new domain controller. A report indicates several open ports on the server. Which of the following ports should the administrator disable?

discussion.content: D would be the best answer here, although if I'm working in the DC everyday all day my choice is RSAT over RDP but I guess one is more secure than the other depending.

Selected Answer: D
Considering servers usually have redundant power supply's I don't think this would cause the system to any run any different. I would go with Raid battery here.

questions.question_text: Following a recent power outage, a server on a server farm has been running slowly. A technician receives a ticket with a request to check for anything out of the ordinary. The technician sees an orange light on the front console of the server, indicating an error. Which of the following should the technician check next?
